Comparisons were made with previous studies where the same genes had been analyzed using semiquantitative RT-PCR, RT-qPCR or in situ hybridization (see supplementary Table S6 online). These transcripts correspond to annotated genes Myc, Serum amyloid A, Mtf, WNT9, BMP, β-catenin and survivin, and all of them shared the fact that their expression in the early intestinal rudiment (1–3 dpe) had been compared to that of the normal mesentery
20, 26– 29 . Our RNA-seq expression analysis for all these genes showed a similar expression pattern to their expression in prior studies. Thus, Myc, Serum amyloid A, Mtf, WNT9, BMP, were over-expressed while β-catenin and survivin showed no considerable difference between regenerating intestine and normal mesentery. To further validate our data, we selected 7 additional genes that were differentially expressed in our RNAseq and probed their expression using RT-qPCR. The analyzed upregulated genes were VBP, Wnt6, Sox4, TAP26 and Mortalin. On the other hand, downregulated genes included FoxA and Tenascin. The expression values were compared between the RNA-seq and RT-qPCR expression data. In all cases the data from both day 1 and 3 were used, with the exemption of Tenascin and Mortalin with only the day 3 values. The comparison showed a high correlation between both results with a square of the Pearson’s correlation coefficient of 0.91 (Fig. 2D).
